title: Bitcoin Drops to Lowest Price Since Trump Was Elected as Crypto Faces Slump
summary: The price of Bitcoin is now lower than when President Trump was elected in 2024, raising concerns of a new “crypto winter" in the industry.

title: Amazon’s $200 Billion Spending Plan Raises Stakes in A.I. Race
summary: The company reported a strong holiday quarter on Thursday. But its spending, like that at other big technology companies, is starting to make investors nervous.

title: Senators Clash Over Immigration Enforcement, Risking a D.H.S. Shutdown
summary: With eight days until a deadline to keep the Department of Homeland Security running, bipartisan talks on reining in federal immigration agents’ tactics appeared to sputter before they had even gotten underway.

title: Kennedy Makes Unfounded Claim That Keto Diet Can ‘Cure’ Schizophrenia
summary: The claim vastly overstates preliminary research into whether the high-fat, low-carbohydrate diet might help people with the disorder, experts said.

title: White House Offers Shifting Story on Gabbard’s Presence at Georgia Raid
summary: President Trump said Thursday that Attorney General Pam Bondi had directed Tulsi Gabbard to be present for an operation at an election center. It was the administration’s fourth explanation for her presence.

title: Carney Increases E.V. Investments as Trump’s Trade Policy Disrupts Canada’s Auto Industry
summary: Prime Minister Mark Carney announced several measures Thursday aimed at making Canada a global leader in electric vehicles and rescuing an industry ravaged by U.S. trade policy.

title: U.S. Automakers’ Foreign Troubles Now Extend to Canada
summary: U.S. trade policy has devastated the Canadian auto industry and pushed the country to reach an agreement that will make it easier for Chinese companies to sell cars there.

title: 12 Columbia Professors and Students Are Arrested at Anti-ICE Protest
summary: Demonstrators, who were demanding that the university provide more protection for international students, blocked Broadway.

title: The G.O.P. Senator Who Can’t Stop Thinking About the Boy ICE Detained
summary: Katie Britt is uniquely positioned to reason with the Trump administration — when she chooses to speak up.

title: Jessie Diggins is the Olympian Testing the Limits of Endurance
summary: Jessie Diggins has become the best-ever American cross-country skier because of what she pushes her body through.

title: Italy Toughens Protest Laws, Hours Before Planned Rallies at Winter Olympics
summary: The restrictions could affect people demonstrating this weekend outside Olympic events in northern Italy.

title: At Ukraine’s Request, Starlink Denies Internet Access to Russian Troops
summary: It’s unclear what effect the change will have on Russia’s ability to wage war, but Russian military bloggers said troops were experiencing internet outages that hampered frontline communications.

title: Camera Was Disconnected From Nancy Guthrie’s Home Shortly Before Disappearance
summary: The authorities confirmed that blood on Ms. Guthrie’s doorstep belonged to her. Her daughter Savannah, the “Today” anchor, released a video asking for proof that her mother is alive.

title: Savannah Guthrie’s Video Shows a Rare and Anguished Reality
summary: Morning show hosts have shown a vulnerable, candid side to their audiences before, but not like this.

title: What to Know About the Disappearance of Savannah Guthrie’s Mom, Nancy
summary: Nancy Guthrie, 84, the “Today” show host’s mother, was last seen on Saturday night, the authorities said. The disappearance is being investigated as a possible kidnapping.

title: Nancy Guthrie Kidnapping Shows Limits of Tracking Pacemakers in Police Work
summary: The heart devices do not track location, nor do they transmit across large distances.

title: Who Has ‘Dibs’ on That Freshly Shoveled Parking Space?
summary: Laying claim to the parking spot you shoveled after a blizzard tends to be a respected tradition in northern cities, but a spate of confrontations is a reminder of just how precious a spot can be.

title: New York City Forecast to See More Snow and then Bitter Cold
summary: A fast-moving storm this weekend could drop new snow on the grimy piles that have accumulated across the city. Bitter cold will follow.

title: Dozens of Earthquakes Have Rattled San Ramon, California
summary: San Ramon, Calif., has been rattled by dozens of small earthquakes in recent months. Even in a region used to regular shaking, it’s been a lot.

title: Rare Deep-Sea Giant Phantom Jellyfish Sighting Is Recorded on Video
summary: During a dive off Argentina, scientists documented a rare jellyfish discovered a little over a century ago and seldom seen since, as well as the fish that keep it company.

title: ‘Melania’: Watching a First Lady Vanish in Plain Sight
summary: Glamour, silence and a very big hat.

title: The Louvre Thieves Dropped This Priceless Crown. Now It Looks Like This.
summary: Empress Eugénie’s crown was left lying on the sidewalk after the Louvre Museum heist in October. The museum has now released pictures of the damage.

title: C.I.A. World Factbook Ends Publication After 6 Decades
summary: The Factbook, a version of which dates to 1962, provided facts, figures, maps and more to generations of economists, professors, journalists and others.

title: Toronto Police Charged in Sweeping Drug and Corruption Case
summary: After hit men targeted the home of a prison manager in June, investigators say, the schemes of a criminal network involving the police unraveled.

title: LA Olympics Chief Keeps Low Profile in Milan Games After Appearing in Epstein Files
summary: Casey Wasserman, who is leading preparations for the 2028 Summer Games, has expressed “regret” after messages he exchanged with Ghislaine Maxwell decades ago surfaced.
